title: Saving Lives Through Increased Support for Mental- and Behavioral-Health Needs

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to improve support for mental and behavioral health, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. It establishes a Coronavirus Mental Health Working Group to coordinate efforts, encourages safe in-person and telehealth services, and promotes grant funding for programs that aid mental health recovery and suicide prevention.
potential_concerns: Expanding in-person and telehealth mental health services during COVID-19 may pose health risks for vulnerable populations, particularly individuals-with-mental-health-conditions and seniors-elderly, if safety protocols are insufficient.
Encouragement of in-person religious and communal support activities might conflict with public health guidelines, potentially putting faith-based-communities at risk during the pandemic.
Small-business-owners face challenges balancing economic reopening to support mental health with public health risks of COVID-19 transmission in communal settings.
Rural-communities may experience limited improvement in telehealth access due to broadband infrastructure gaps, hindering equitable benefit from this order's provisions.
Domestic-violence-survivors may face difficulties accessing safe mental health support if in-person services are deprioritized or restricted amid pandemic-related safeguards.
